00021 #include "CopyNumberHMM.h"
00022 
00023 #include <vector>
00024 
00025 using namespace std;
00026 
00027 
00028 // Need to throw exceptions when real users come along.
00029 CopyNumberHMM::CopyNumberHMM(
00030         const TransitionMatrix TransMat_in)
00031         : TransMat(TransMat_in) { }
00032 
00033 
00034 // Write over the top of any old data with new data.
00035 void CopyNumberHMM::add_data(
00036         const valarray<double> & data_in,
00037         const valarray<double> & mu_in,
00038         const valarray<double> & var_in)
00039     {
00040     _data.resize(data_in.size());
00041     _data = data_in;
00042     _mu.resize(mu_in.size());
00043     _mu = mu_in;
00044     _prec.resize(this->size());
00045     _prec = 1.0/var_in;
00046     }
00047 
00048 
00049 valarray<int> CopyNumberHMM::solve_map(bool constantMeansFlag)
00050     {
00051     const unsigned int N = _data.size();  // number of nodes in the HMM
00052     const unsigned int P = this->size();  // number of states per node
00053     vector<CopyNumberNode>cnn;
00054     cnn.reserve(N);
00055 
00056     // This spares the need to allocate copies of many little slices
00057     valarray<double>mu_marker(P);
00058     mu_marker = _mu[slice(0,P,1)];
00059 
00060     cnn.push_back(CopyNumberNode(TransMat,_data[0],mu_marker,_prec));
00061 
00062     for (unsigned int t=1; t<_data.size(); t++) {
00063         if (!constantMeansFlag) mu_marker = _mu[slice(t*P,P,1)];
00064             cnn.push_back(CopyNumberNode(cnn[t-1],TransMat,_data[t],
00065             mu_marker, _prec));
00066         }
00067 
00068     valarray<int>copy_number(N);
00069     copy_number[N-1] = cnn[N-1].backward();
00070 
00071     for (unsigned int t=1; t<N; t++)
00072         copy_number[N-t-1] = cnn[N-t].backward(copy_number[N-t]);
00073 
00074     return copy_number;
00075     }
